plant_concentrations.Value: Unspecified isomers of heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin were found in 67 samples of vegetation from the UK sampled during July-Aug 1986 at concn ranging from 2.1-44.0 ng/kg dry weight basis (avg 8.8 ng/kg)(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Hutzinger O et al; Chemosphere 14: 581-600 (1985) (2) Clement RE et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 39: 1069-75 (1987) (3) Miyata H et al; Chemosphere 16: 1817-22 (1987)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was found at a concn of 0.005 ppb in fish tissue from yellow perch collected from Woods Pond, MA, a pond known to be contaminated with Aroclor 1260, a PCB (date of sampling not specified)(1). Both isomers of heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin were detected in samples of American lobster (Homarus americanus) digestive glands collected in May 1983 and May 1984 from 3 of 5 sites in maritime Canada; lobsters tissue from Miramachi Bay and Limestone Point, New Brunswick and the South Arm of Sydney Harbor, Nova Scotia contained concn (avg of duplicate analyses) of 14, 4, and 9 pg/g (wet weight basis) of the two isomers of heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin(2). The two sites where no heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin residues were detected in the lobster tissue were the mouth of Sydney Harbor and Port Morien, Nova Scotia(2). The three sites where these isomers were detected in the lobster tissues were known to receive effluents from industry(2). The concn of total heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin found in blue mussels (Mitilus edulus) from coastal Japan in the Osaka area were as follows: Misaki-Cho, 8.9-40 parts/trillion, (avg 20 parts/trillion) and Hokko, 11-37 parts/trillion (22 parts/trillion avg); in the Hokaido area one sample from Funka Bay contained 6.0 parts/trillion and samples from Risheri Island did not contain detectable concn (detection limit 1 parts/trillion)(3).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Stevens RJJ; A Review of Lake Ontario Water Quality with emphasis on the 1981-1982 Intensive Years. Rep to Surveillance Subcommittee Great Lakes Water Qual Board. Int Joint Commission, Windsor, Ontario. Oct 1988. p. 169 (1988) (2) Hutzinger O et al; Chemosphere 14: 581-600 (1985) (3) Meyer C et al; Chemosphere 19: 21-6 (1989) (4) Hallett DJ, Brooksbank MG; Chemosphere 15: 1405-16 (1986)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: The mean daily loadings for heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in the Niagara River at Niagara-on-the-Lake based upon monitoring data for between 1984 and 1986 were 6.4 and 2.3 g/day for the water column and suspended sediment, respectively(1). Heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was found at a concn of 0.92 ppb in sediments samples collected from Woods Pond, MA, a pond known to be contaminated with Aroclor 1260, a PCB (date of sampling not specified)(2). The concn of total heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin and the 1,2,3,4,6,7,8-isomer in sediment in the surface water raw drinking water supplies of Lockport, NY, sampled in 1988 were 535 and 285 parts/trillion, respectively, in raw water pump station, wet-well sediment and 280 and 150 parts/trillion, respectively, in sedimentation basin sludge(3). Unspecified isomers of heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin were found in 5 of 8 samples of suspended sediments collected from the Niagara River from Dec 1984-Feb 1985 at concn up to 238 ng/g (detection limit not specified)(4).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Rappe C, Kjeller LO; Chemosphere 16: 1775-80 (1987) (2) Pereira WE et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 4: 629-39 (1985)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Three samples of trapped sediments from the archipelago of Stockholm, Sweden (date of sampling not specified) contained 880, 1200 and 5700 pg/g of total heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin(1). Samples of pond sludge and sediment collected in 1983 from two surface impoundments that receive discharge of effluents from a wood-treating facility in Pensacola, FL (facility was closed in 1981), contained total heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin concn of 39.5 and 94 mg/kg, respectively(2).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Berlincioni M, Di Domenico A; Environ Sci Technol 21: 1063-9 (1987) (2) Rappe C, Kjeller LO; Chemosphere 16: 1775-80 (1987) (3) Schecter A et al; Chemosphere 18: 831-4 (1989)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Total heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin concn found in soil sampled on Feb 27, 1985, near the municipal incinerator of Florence, Italy, at 5 of 6 sites (detection limit not specified) at concn ranging from 5.8 to 97 pg/g (avg concn 56 pg/g); the site which was negative was chosen as a control site to evaluate the background concn in soil(1). Total levels of heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in samples of soil from 5 sites sampled Sept 18, 1985, at a farm near the incinerator contained levels ranging from 24-70 pg/g (avg concn 43 pg/g)(1). Total concn of all isomers in three samples of soil from various rural areas of Europe (sites and data of sampling not specified) ranged from <10 pg/g (quantitation limit) in 2 samples to 17 pg/g in the other sample; 2 samples from more industrialized areas of Europe contained 370 and 1600 pg/g(2). Five samples of bottom sediment from the Dong Nai River, Vietnam, collected in 1984-85 contained 63-160 pg/g dry weight of total heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin (avg 110 pg/g); one sample from the Saigon River contained 940 pg/g and two samples from the Red River contained 10 and 5.1 pg/g(3).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Pereira WE et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 4: 629-39 (1985) (2) Chang R et al; Chemosphere 19: 481-6 (1989)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: The concn of total heptachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in samples collected in 1983 of porous media from the unsaturated zone in an area downgradient from surface impoundments at a wood-treating facility in Pensacola, FL (facility was closed in 1981), ranged between not detected (detection limits not specified) and 874.6 ug/kg dry weight; concn in porous material from the saturated zone ranged between not detected and 80 ug/kg dry weight(1). The concn found in soil samples collected in March 1988 in the Oroville, CA advisory area 1.5 km southeast of a pentachlorophenol plant near Polermo, CA, at which a fire occurred in April 1987 was 1403 parts/trillion; the background concn detected at a rural site not near the facility was 9.0 parts/trillion(2).
